page.title: 15Whitwell Common.
page.content: Whitwell common is so marshy,a calf sank in it.It is a good place for plants and crops.We had a walking stick cabbage which grew to twenty feet tall because the land is so damp and good.We keep goats, chickens,geese on the meadow.We have about one acre of land.It has not been ploughed ever because a tractor would get bogged down.There is a plant called a horsetail which likes to grow in wet, damp places .We have a lot of holly alder,ash, oak and hawthorn trees and bushes.Reeds,yellow iris and marsh marigolds grow in the marshy places.We have lots of birds. There is a bittern which hides in the reeds.The heron fishes sticklebacks out of the pond. The mallards hide in the nettles and when you get there they make a big noise and fly off.Warblers nest in the bushes in the summer.
